00032 #ifndef _rc_reader_h_
00033 #define _rc_reader_h_
00034 
00035 #include <iostream>
00036 #include <string>

00038 using std::string;
00039 using std::ofstream;
00040 using std::ifstream;
00041 using std::endl;
00042 
00051 class RCReader {
00052 private:
00053     string d_rc_file_path;
00054     string d_cache_root;
00055 
00056     bool _dods_use_cache;   // 0- Disabled 1- Enabled
00057     unsigned long _dods_cache_max; // Max cache size in Mbytes
00058     unsigned long _dods_cached_obj; // Max cache entry size in Mbytes
00059     int _dods_ign_expires;  // 0- Honor expires 1- Ignore them
00060   
00061     // NB: NEVER_DEFLATE: I added this (12/1/99 jhrg) because libwww 5.2.9
00062     // cannot process compressed (i.e., deflated) documents in the cache.
00063     // Users must be able to choose whether they want compressed data that
00064     // will always be refreshed or uncompressed data that will be cached.
00065     // When set this flag overrides the value passed into the Connect
00066     // object's constructor. This gives users control over the value.
00067     // Previously, this could only be set by the program that called
00068     // Connect(...). Note that I've now (4/6/2000 jhrg) fixed libwww so this
00069     // parameter is no longer needed.111
00070     //
00071     // Added back in, but with a better name (removed double negative).
00072     // 6/27/2002 jhrg
00073     bool _dods_deflate;     // 1- request comp responses, 0- don't
00074   
00075     int _dods_default_expires;  // 24 hours in seconds
00076     int _dods_always_validate;  // Let libwww decide by default so set to 0
00077   
00078     // flags for PROXY_SERVER=<protocol>,<host url>
00079     string _dods_proxy_server_protocol;
00080     string _dods_proxy_server_host_url;
00081 
00082     // flags for PROXY_FOR=<regex>,<proxy host url>,<flags>
00083     bool _dods_proxy_for;   // true if proxy_for is used.
00084     string _dods_proxy_for_regexp;
00085     string _dods_proxy_for_proxy_host_url;
00086     int _dods_proxy_for_regexp_flags; // not used w/libcurl. 6/27/2002 jhrg
00087 
00088     //flags for NO_PROXY_FOR=<protocol>,<host>,<port>
00089     bool _dods_no_proxy_for;    // true if no_proxy_for is used.
00090     string _dods_no_proxy_for_protocol;
00091     string _dods_no_proxy_for_proxy_host;
00092     int _dods_no_proxy_for_port; // not used w/libcurl. 6/27/2002 jhrg
00093 
00094     // Make this a vector of strings or support a PATH-style list. 02/26/03
00095     // jhrg 
00096     string d_ais_database;
00097     
00098     static RCReader* _instance;
00099 
00100     RCReader();
00101     ~RCReader();
00102   
00103     // File I/O methods
00104     bool write_rc_file(const string &pathname);
00105     bool read_rc_file(const string &pathname);
00106 
00107     // Look for the RC file
00108     string check_env_var(const string &variable_name);
00109     string check_string(string env_var);
00110 
00111     friend void initialize_instance();
00112     friend void rcreader_clean();
00113 
00114     friend class RCReaderTest;
00115 
00116 public:
00117     static RCReader* instance();
00118   
00119     // GET METHODS
00120     const string get_dods_cache_root() {return d_cache_root;}
00121     const bool get_use_cache() throw()      {return _dods_use_cache;}
00122     const int get_max_cache_size()  throw()  {return _dods_cache_max;}
00123     const unsigned long get_max_cached_obj() throw()   {return _dods_cached_obj;}
00124     const int get_ignore_expires() throw()  {return _dods_ign_expires;}
00125     const int get_default_expires() throw() {return _dods_default_expires;}
00126     const int get_always_validate() throw() {return _dods_always_validate;}
00127 
00128     const bool get_deflate() throw()   {return _dods_deflate;}
00129 
00130     const string get_proxy_server_protocol() throw() {return _dods_proxy_server_protocol;}
00131     const string get_proxy_server_host_url()  throw() {return _dods_proxy_server_host_url;}
00132     bool is_proxy_for_used() throw() {return _dods_proxy_for;}
00133     const string get_proxy_for_regexp() throw() {return _dods_proxy_for_regexp;}
00134     const string get_proxy_for_proxy_host_url() throw() {return _dods_proxy_for_proxy_host_url;}
00135     // @deprecated
00136     const int get_proxy_for_regexp_flags() throw() {return _dods_proxy_for_regexp_flags;}
00137     bool is_no_proxy_for_used() throw() {return _dods_no_proxy_for;}
00138     const string get_no_proxy_for_protocol() throw() {return _dods_no_proxy_for_protocol;}
00139     const string get_no_proxy_for_host() throw() {return _dods_no_proxy_for_proxy_host;}
00140     const int    get_no_proxy_for_port() throw() {return _dods_no_proxy_for_port;}
00141 
00142     string get_ais_database() const throw() {return d_ais_database;}
00143 
00144     // SET METHODS
00145     void set_use_cache(bool b) throw() {_dods_use_cache=b;}
00146     void set_max_cache_size(int i) throw() {_dods_cache_max=i;}
00147     void set_max_cached_obj(int i) throw() {_dods_cached_obj=i;}
00148     void set_ignore_expires(int i) throw() {_dods_ign_expires=i;}
00149     void set_default_expires(int i) throw() { _dods_default_expires=i;}
00150     void set_always_validate(int i) throw() {_dods_always_validate=i;}
00151 
00152     void set_deflate(bool b) throw() {_dods_deflate=b;}
00153 
00154     void set_proxy_server_protocol(const string &s) throw() {_dods_proxy_server_protocol=s;}
00155     void set_proxy_server_host_url(const string &s) throw() {_dods_proxy_server_host_url=s;}
00156     void set_proxy_for_regexp(const string &s) throw() { _dods_proxy_for_regexp=s;}
00157     void set_proxy_for_proxy_host_url(const string &s) throw() {_dods_proxy_for_proxy_host_url=s;}
00158     void set_proxy_for_regexp_flags(int i) throw() {_dods_proxy_for_regexp_flags=i;}
00159     void set_no_proxy_for_protocol(const string &s) throw() {_dods_no_proxy_for_protocol=s;}
00160     void set_no_proxy_for_host(const string &s) throw() {_dods_no_proxy_for_proxy_host=s;}
00161     void set_no_proxy_for_port(int i) throw() {_dods_no_proxy_for_port=i;}
00162 
00163     void set_ais_database(const string &db) throw() {d_ais_database = db;}
00164 };

00169 // up being set to a negative number. I also changed the types of the cache
00170 // size and entry size from int to unsigned long. Added information to
00171 // the default .dodsrc file explaining the units of the CACHE_SIZE and

00177 // fixed. I added some unit tests (see RCReaderTest). I think it's probably a
00178 // bad idea to have the code that looks for the RC file create it if it's not
00179 // found, but the alternative is messier.
